explains: adj. 不能安抚的；难和解的；不能缓和的

sentences.en: He was looking at Wolf Larsen, the old and implacable snarl of hatred strong as ever on his face.
sentences.cn: 他正瞧着海狼赖生，从前的不能和解的憎恨的表情，依旧强烈地留在他的脸上。

sentences.en: Even the bill's most implacable opponents acknowledged its importance in transforming us energy use.
sentences.cn: 即使最顽固的反对者也承认该议案在转变美国能源使用方式方面的重要性。

sentences.en: But to Mr Mubarak's chagrin the vast crowds of detractors gathered in Egypt's streets proved implacable.
sentences.cn: 让穆巴拉克头痛的是埃及街道上集结的反对派看来是很难平息的。
